messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: there are [0-9]+ clusters'

Imagine a group of 16 scholars. Amir is connected to Wim, Raj, Jing, and Reza. Wim is connected to Amir, Raj, Jing, and Eva. Raj is connected to Amir, Wim, Jing, and Wei. Jing is also connected to Amir, Wim, Raj, and Pam. Wei is connected to Nisha, Reza, Kim, and Raj. Nisha is connected to Wei, Reza, Kim, and Sara. Reza is connected to Amir, Kim, Nisha, and Wei. Kim is also connected to Wei, Nisha, Reza, and Moin. Ian is connected to Moin, Puja, Sara, and Matt. Moin is connected to Ian, Puja, Kim, and Sara. Puja is connected to Pari, Ian, Sara, and Moin. Sara is also connected to Ian, Moin, Puja, and Nisha. Pari is connected to Pam, Matt, Eva, and Puja. Pam is connected to Jing, Pari, Matt, and Eva. Matt is connected to Pari, Pam, Eva, and Ian. Eva is also connected to Pari, Pam, Matt, and Wim. How many densely-connected clusters of scholars are there in this group? A densely-connected cluster is a group of scholars that are connected to themselves with a minimum of 2 scholars.

Great, I can definitely help you with that! To determine the number of densely-connected clusters, we need to look at each scholar and see if they are connected to themselves.
Step 1: Let's start by looking at Amir. Amir is connected to Wim, Raj, Jing, and Reza. None of these scholars are also connected to Amir, so he is not part of a densely-connected cluster.
Step 2: Next, let's look at Wim. Wim is connected to Amir, Raj, Jing, and Eva. Again, none of these scholars are also connected to Wim, so he is not part of a densely-connected cluster.
Step 3: Moving on to Raj, we see that he is connected to Amir, Wim, Jing, and Wei. Only Jing is also connected to Raj, so he is part of one densely-connected cluster.
Step 4: Jing is connected to Amir, Wim, Raj, and Reza. All of these scholars are also connected to Jing, so she is part of two densely-connected clusters.
Step 5: Wei is connected to Nisha, Reza, Kim, and Raj. None of these scholars are also connected to Wei, so he is not part of a densely-connected cluster.
Step 6: Nisha is connected to Wei, Reza, Kim, and Raj. All of these scholars are also connected to Nisha, so she is part of one densely-connected cluster.
Step 7: Reza is connected to Amir, Kim, Nisha, and Wei. All of these scholars are also connected to Reza, so he is part of two densely-connected clusters.
Step 8: Kim is connected to Wei, Nisha, Reza, and Moin. All of these scholars are also connected to Kim, so she is part of one densely-connected cluster.
Step 9: Ian is connected to Moin, Puja, Sara, and Matt. Only Matt is also connected to Ian, so he is not part of a densely-connected cluster.
Step 10: Moin is connected to Ian, Puja, Kim, and Sara. All of these scholars are also connected to Moin, so he is part of two densely-connected clusters.
Step 11: Puja is connected to Pari, Ian, Sara, and Moin. All of these scholars are also connected to Puja, so she is part of one densely-connected cluster.
Step 12: Sara is connected to Ian, Moin, Puja, and Nisha. All of these scholars are also connected to Sara, so she is part of two densely-connected clusters.
Step 13: Pari is connected to Pam, Matt, Eva, and Puja. All of these scholars are also connected to Pari, so she is part of one densely-connected cluster.
Step 14: Pam is connected to Jing, Pari, Matt, and Eva. All of these scholars are also connected to Pam, so she is part of one densely-connected cluster.
Step 15: Matt is connected to Pari, Pam, Eva, and Ian. All of these scholars are also connected to Matt, so he is part of two densely-connected clusters.
Step 16: Finally, Eva is connected to Pari, Pam, Matt, and Wim. All of these scholars are also connected to Eva, so she is part of two densely-connected clusters.
Based on the number of densely-connected clusters, the answer is: there are 9 densely-connected clusters.
